===Etymology===
{{unk.|lang=zh}}, perhaps from {{der|zh|sog||tr=s'rtp'w||leader of caravan; caravaneer}}, which is an Irano-Indian hybrid from {{der|zh|sa|सार्थ||caravan}} + {{der|zh|peo|tr=*pāvā|||protector}}. Compare {{der|zh|sa|सार्थवाह||merchant; trader; leader or conductor of a caravan}}.

Compare {{cog|ug|tr=sartpau|||leader of a group of merchants}}, {{cog|bo|སར་ཕག}}, {{cog|peo|𐎧𐏁𐏂𐎱𐎠𐎺𐎠||tr=xšaçapāvā|[[satrap]]; governor of a Persian province}}.

===Noun===

# {{lb|zh|historical|Tang Dynasty}} A religious title granted to an [[Iranian]] who was appointed, in a semi-official function, to act as a controller of [[Zoroastrians]] in [[Tang Dynasty]] China.
